definition: perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: Years before, Van Buren had done much himself to elect Jackson to the White House.
sentences.chinese: 幾年前，範布倫爲傑克遜入主白宮立下了汗馬功勞。

sentences.english: Find and scent, my compadres and you too, shall have much rewarding from the master.
sentences.chinese: 同志們，找到氣味，主人不會忘記我們的汗馬功勞。

sentences.english: Keep you boss aware of your accomplishments.
sentences.chinese: 讓老闆不斷留意你的汗馬功勞。

sentences.english: Bazookas have a long range and are very destructive, they make a strong contribution in wars.
sentences.chinese: 火箭炮的射程遠，殺傷力強，在戰爭中立下汗馬功勞。

sentences.english: Find and scent, my compadres and you too, shall have much rewarding from the master.
sentences.chinese: 同志們，找到氣味，主人不會忘卻我們的汗馬功勞。

definition: running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
